page.title: 01Around Bilsdale West Moor
page.content: The area described is a moorland area, part of the Cleveland Hills within the North Yorkshire Moors National Park. It lies just to the west of the B1257 Great Broughton to Helmsley road. Several public footpaths traverse the area, giving easy access to the moors. The moors contain a varied wildlife includng grouse, a moor fowl, and adders, small venomous snakes. Moorland is used by the local farmers for sheep grazing. The television mast at grid reference 553962 forms the focal point of the area. It extends over 1050ft above ground level, some 2297 feet above mean sea level. It provides four colour television channels to the community in the North East of England, extending to Peter Lee in the North, York in the south, Leyburn to the West and Scarborough to the
